page.title: 05CELLULAR RADIO - OFFCHURCH
page.content: Recently erected at Burnt Heath Farm was a{Cellular Radio Mast,}jointly owned by{British Telecom (Cellmet)}and {Racal Vodaphone.}Each company operates an independent radio link for "in car" telephones. The mast is one of a chain spread across the area and transmits over a radius of about 25 kilometres. Users, while travelling along, have their calls directed through the nearest mast automatically by giant computers. { The two companies}are in competition with each other and operate on separate frequencies, but where it is convenient they sometimes, as in this case, use the same mast to relay signals. The system is a recent development and this mast is only now coming into use. { It forms a land mark on the high land {which can be seen from Cubbington.
